comment._content: This looks like the Essex Regiment badge: www.britishbadge.co.uk/popup_image.php?pID=689 and www.northeastmedals.co.uk/british_regiment/essex_regiment...

comment.author: 76348108@N04
comment._content: ive never thuoght about htis , i go everyyear to the somme thipval memoreal as my paternal gran lost her uncle and his name is on it, she rememberd him as a 7 year old girl and her mum crying that he had been killed but thay never found his body that is if there was anything left, but not having a photo like most people know dought you could see a pic of a soldier from ww 1 and not know it as your relative. love this site thanks for all your work.

comment.author: 46712921@N05
comment._content:
I was lucky enough to visit the "In Flanders Field" museum in Ypres some years ago and one of the most poignant displays were all the unclaimed photographs of British soldiers from the town's photographer's studios. Unclaimed because the soldier in question did not get back to claim it. All those pictures - probably the last one ever taken - packed away with no names. If only we could find out who they were!
Yes, it is an Essex Regt badge. Born & bred in the county. Several ancestors served in their battalions. I wonder.....
